statements.name: PROC DSTRANS
statements.description: The DSTRANS procedure translates a subset of SAS DATA step code into DS2 language statements. Then, if necessary, you can revise your program to take advantage of DS2 functionality and submit your program in a Base SAS session using the DS2 procedure.

arguments.name: DSI_TO_DS2
arguments.description: Requests to dynamically enter the DATA step code to be translated in line as a submit block. To create a submit block, enter a SUBMIT statement (which must appear on a line by itself), followed by the DATA step code to be translated, and then enter an ENDSUBMIT statement (which must appear on a line by itself) to terminate the submit block.

arguments.name: IN=
arguments.description: Specifies either a SAS fileref that is assigned to the input DATA step (.sas) file or the physical location of the input file. To assign a fileref, use the FILENAME statement. To specify the physical location, include the complete pathname and the filename and enclose the physical location in single or double quotation marks.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Specifies either a SAS fileref that is assigned to the output DS2 file (.ds2) or the filename of the output file. To assign a fileref, use the FILENAME statement. To specify the filename, enclose the filename in single or double quotation marks. Restriction: You can specify only one output file.

arguments.name: OUTDIR=
arguments.description: Specifies the complete pathname of the output file physical location. Requirement: You must specify the final directory separator, for example, outdir='C:\2012\sasfig\'. Note that the directory separator is host specific. For example, Windows uses the backslash (\) and UNIX uses the forward slash (/).

statements.name: CONTINUE
statements.description: [Use only inside a SUBMIT-ENDSUBMIT block.] Stops processing the current DO-loop iteration and resumes processing the next iteration.

arguments.name: BY
arguments.description: Precedes an increment integer (other than 0) or an expression that generates an integer to be added to the value of the index variable in each iteration of the DO loop.

arguments.name: TO
arguments.description: Separates the start and stop integers or expressions that control the number of times the portion of the DATA step between the iterative DO and END statements is processed.

arguments.name: UNTIL
arguments.description: ...more SAS statements... END

statements.name: ELSE
statements.description: If the condition in an IF-THEN statement is false and an ELSE statement is present, then the ELSE action is carried out. [Use only inside a SUBMIT-ENDSUBMIT block.]

arguments.name: DO
arguments.description: Action statement in an IF-THEN-ELSE construct.

arguments.name: IF
arguments.description: Executes a SAS statement for observations that meet specific conditions.

arguments.name: OUTPUT
arguments.description: Action statement in an IF-THEN-ELSE construct.

arguments.name: THEN
arguments.description: If the conditions that are specified in the IF clause are met, the IF-THEN statement executes a SAS statement for observations that are read from a SAS data set, for records in an external file, or for computed values.

statements.name: ENDSUBMIT
statements.description: Marks the end of a submit block. Requirements: The ENDSUBMIT statement requires the PROC DSTRANS statement argument DSI_TO_DS2. Use the ENDSUBMIT statement with the SUBMIT statement to indicate a block of DATA step code to submit for translation.

statements.name: GOTO
statements.description: [Use only inside a SUBMIT-ENDSUBMIT block.] Jumps to a new statement.

arguments.name: CALL
arguments.description: Invokes a SAS CALL routine.

arguments.name: DO
arguments.description: Action statement in an IF-THEN construct.

arguments.name: GO
arguments.description: Jumps to a new statement.

arguments.name: OUTPUT
arguments.description: Action statement in an IF-THEN construct.

arguments.name: PUT
arguments.description: Action statement in an IF-THEN construct.

arguments.name: RETURN
arguments.description: Action statement in an IF-THEN construct. Stops executing statements at the current point in the DATA step and returns to a predetermined point in the step.

arguments.name: SET
arguments.description: Reads an observation from one or more SAS data sets.

arguments.name: STOP
arguments.description: Action statement in an IF-THEN construct. Stops execution of the current DATA step.

arguments.name: THEN
arguments.description: If the conditions that are specified in the IF clause are met, the IF-THEN statement executes a SAS statement for observations that are read from a SAS data set, for records in an external file, or for computed values.

arguments.name: WHEN
arguments.description: WHEN statement in an IF-THEN-WHEN construct.

statements.name: LEAVE
statements.description: [Use only inside a SUBMIT-ENDSUBMIT block.] Stops processing the current loop and resumes with the next statement in the sequence.

statements.name: LENGTH
statements.description: [Use only inside a SUBMIT-ENDSUBMIT block.] Specifies the number of bytes for storing variables.

arguments.name: DEFAULT=
arguments.description: Changes the default number of bytes that SAS uses to store the values of any newly created numeric variables.

statements.name: LINK
statements.description: [Use only inside a SUBMIT-ENDSUBMIT block.] Directs program execution immediately to the statement label that is specified and, if followed by a RETURN statement, returns execution to the statement that follows the LINK statement.

arguments.name: DO
arguments.description: Action statement.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: [Use only inside a SUBMIT-ENDSUBMIT block.] Writes the current observation to a SAS data set.

statements.name: PUT
statements.description: [Use only inside a SUBMIT-ENDSUBMIT block.] Writes lines to the SAS log, to the SAS output window, or to an external location that is specified in the most recent FILE statement.

arguments.name: OVERPRINT
arguments.description: Causes the values that follow the keyword OVERPRINT to print on the most recently written output line.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: Writes the values of all variables, which includes automatic variables, that are defined in the current DATA step by using named output.

arguments.name: _BLANKPAGE_
arguments.description: Advances the pointer to the first line of a new page, even when the pointer is positioned on the first line and the first column of a new page.

arguments.name: _INFILE_
arguments.description: Writes the last input data record that is read either from the current input file or from the data lines that follow a DATELINES statement.

arguments.name: _ODS_
arguments.description: Moves data values for all columns (as defined by the ODS option in the FILE statement) into a special buffer, from which it is eventually written to the data component. The ODS option in the FILE statement defines the structure of the data component that holds the results of the DATA step.

arguments.name: _PAGE_
arguments.description: Advances the pointer to the first line of a new page. SAS automatically begins a new page when a line exceeds the current PAGESIZE= value.

statements.name: RETURN
statements.description: [Use only inside a SUBMIT-ENDSUBMIT block.] Stops executing statements at the current point in the DATA step and returns to a predetermined point in the step.

statements.name: STOP
statements.description: [Use only inside a SUBMIT-ENDSUBMIT block.] Stops execution of the current DATA step.

statements.name: SUBMIT
statements.description: Labels the beginning of a submit block. Requirements: The SUBMIT statement requires the PROC DSTRANS statement argument DSI_TO_DS2. Use the SUBMIT statement with the ENDSUBMIT statement to indicate a block of DATA step code to submit for translation.

arguments.name: DO
arguments.description: Action statement.
